result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court Reporter: Erin Rauber
Preliminary hearing 8/2/22
Atty Francis Raff
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/21/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sean J.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

11:28 AM Defendant Christopher E Tibbs in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis P Raff in court for Christopher E Tibbs.  Prosecuting attorney Valerian Powell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Argument by Defn. State objects, argument by State. CT orders $2000 cash bail. CT refers to Defn to DCPS w/ GPS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

03:56 PM Defendant Christopher E Tibbs in court. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Eligible for SPD, but no appt yet.  Is on a probation hold.  CT will reach out to trial branch and work  on getting an atty appointed. Will set for another STC.
Defendant's Oral Motion Read on the Record.

Defendant Christopher E Tibbs in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin. DE states he has applied for SPD appointment, does not wish to waive time limits, and makes motion for dismissal. Court finds petitions state factual basis, denies dismissal. Court addresses appointment of counsel and waiver of time limits. DE states he still wishes to obtain counsel. Court finds good cause to exceed time limits for appointment of attorney, sets status conference for 5-25-22 at 3pm.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:17 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
